issue.title: Determining non-namespaced class types results in a NPE
issue.body: It is possible to annotate an anonymous class with an attribute and not have a namespacedName property present. This same problem, presumably, exists with a class that isn't namespaced. This ticket should ensure that all class types can be properly gathered.

comment.body: After giving this some more thought, if you're using Annotated Target it is because you want the code constructs _before_ you're actually running the code. I couldn't think of a scenario where Annotated Target could provide its features on an attributed anonymous class. For now, we're gonna throw an exception until somebody can present a valid use case and solution for adding attributes to an anonymous class in the use cases Annotated Target is trying to support.

issue.title: Aliasing an Attribute causes parsing to not recognize it
issue.body:
Currently the PhpParserAnnotatedTargetParser is dependent on the Attribute _not_ being aliased and the string value of the Attribute being used MUST exactly match the FQCN. It should be possible to support gathering an Attribute when searching for the FQCN even if uses of that Attribute in the codebase are with an alias.

---

[This block](https://github.com/cspray/annotated-target/blob/03d99ecfbd27b3ea434b92719fdbe4eb4b0173bb/src/PhpParserAnnotatedTargetParser.php#L83-L85) should be changed to do an `is_subclass_of` check on each filtered attribute.

repo.name: annotated-target
repo.description: A static analysis tool for parsing uses of Attributes in PHP source code.

issue.title: Aliasing an Attribute causes parsing to not recognize it
issue.body:
Currently the PhpParserAnnotatedTargetParser is dependent on the Attribute _not_ being aliased and the string value of the Attribute being used MUST exactly match the FQCN. It should be possible to support gathering an Attribute when searching for the FQCN even if uses of that Attribute in the codebase are with an alias.

---

[This block](https://github.com/cspray/annotated-target/blob/03d99ecfbd27b3ea434b92719fdbe4eb4b0173bb/src/PhpParserAnnotatedTargetParser.php#L83-L85) should be changed to do an `is_subclass_of` check on each filtered attribute.

comment.body: This was actually fixed in v0.2.0 https://github.com/cspray/annotated-target/releases/tag/v0.2.0. A PR was added that specifically addresses this scenario as the test added before does not explicitly address an aliasing scenario.
